See more Indian scientists spot Milky Way-like galaxy from 12 billion years ago The galaxy's discovery challenges our understanding of how galaxies were formed in the early period after the Big Bang. Cough medicine or lemon and honey: Which is better for you? What's the best way to deal with a cough and is lemon and honey as effective as medicine? Electrolyte-packed drinks are said to optimise health and hydration. But do we really need them? 7 August 2025 Share Explore More The health benefits of drinking matcha tea Why walking backwards can be good for your health The hidden calories we consume without knowing Simple tips for cutting back on ultra-processed foods An immersive therapy that can improve your sleep Eight simple steps to help you live longer How your 'second brain' changes the way you think Why you might be younger than you think you are The 'healthier' sweetener that could replace sugar A powerful way to improve your fitness Why drinking coffee can benefit your health How to change your personality traits with intention How you can think yourself well Why being a 'loner' could be good for you An eating habit that helps you maintain a healthy weight A simple practice that is good for stress How immersion in nature can make you feel calmer The benefits of being a 'weekend warrior' Why friendships are key to living longer How to reset your brain with your breath The vegetable that can protect you from cancer A simple and tasty way to reduce wrinkles and keep your skin healthy Why improving your nutrition will help you think better The surprising benefits of self-soothing touch How your gut microbes shape your health Is cold water swimming good for you? Why women 'need less exercise than men' How 'tapping therapy' can help calm your mind Can this mineral help reduce anxiety? Subscribe to Health Fix Health Fix Trusted insights for better health and wellbeing rooted in science, every Wednesday to your inbox. See more Fascinating reads Why singing is surprisingly good for your health From boosting the brain to reducing pain, joining others in song can bring some wide-ranging benefits. The special fat that burns calories when it's cold Brown fat burns energy when we are cold. Now scientists are trying to harness its powers to fight obesity and type 2 diabetes. Why humans enjoy feasting together For thousands of years, humans have come together in small groups to feast on food. Why is it important – and why do we still continue the tradition? How bacteria in the vagina can improve health The microbiome in the vagina has received less attention than its cousin in the gut – but a well-balanced vaginal microbiome can help protect overall health. How to embrace an ageing face Much like our other organs, our skin begins to age from the moment we are born. Here's how you can look after your skin while embracing an ageing face. Why some animals can eat poison and cheat death Creatures consuming species that contain deadly toxins have evolved a suite of clever strategies to stay alive. More science and health 3 days ago How cosmic rays grounded thousands of aircraft Radiation from space that led to more than 6,000 Airbus aircraft needing emergency computer updates could become a growing problem. 3 days ago 2 days ago 'First of its kind' scanner to study blast trauma It will be able to monitor changes in brain function just minutes after weapon use, scientists say. 2 days ago 3 days ago WHO warning over shortage of obesity jabs Too few people who could benefit from so-called "skinny jabs" are able to access them, says WHO. 3 days ago 3 days ago I have high levels of forever chemicals in my blood - what can I do about it? The chemicals would "most likely" impact my health, but there are ways to bring levels down, I was told. 3 days ago 3 days ago Why 2026 will be a year like no other for India's Sun mission For the first time Aditya-L1 will be able to watch the Sun in its maximum activity cycle. 3 days ago 4 days ago Will Ireland's new alcohol warning labels turn people away from drinking? From sober curious to dedicated pint-lovers, 20-somethings tell us about their outlook on drinking. 4 days ago 5 days ago They have six packs - but they're still jumping on and off weight-loss jabs As weight-loss drugs grow more popular, experts warn of the risks of using them without supervision for quick, cosmetic results. 5 days ago 6 days ago Lightning detected on Mars for the first time, scientists say Researchers heard electric crackles on 28 hours of recordings made over two Martian years. 6 days ago 6 days ago At 15 my best friend promised she'd have my baby. Now I'm a mum Georgia and Daisy's childhood closeness later become the foundation for a life-changing act of generosity. 6 days ago ...
